actions.text: The aarakocra makes two Wind Staff attacks, and it can use Spellcasting to cast Gust of Wind.

actions.name: Wind Staff
actions.text: Melee or Ranged Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft. 7 (1d8 + 3) Bludgeoning damage plus 11 (2d10) Lightning damage.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.text:
The aarakocra casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
At will: Elementalism, Gust of Wind, Mage Hand, Message
1/day: Lightning Bolt

reactions.name: Feather Fall (1/Day)
reactions.text: The aarakocra casts Feather Fall in response to that spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

traits.name: None
traits.text: None

actions.name: Talons
actions.text: Melee Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. 4 (1d4 + 2) Slashing damage, or 9 (3d4 + 2) Slashing damage if the aarakocra moved 30+ feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit.

actions.name: Wind Javelin
actions.text: Melee or Ranged Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft. 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) Thunder damage. The javelin magically returns to the aarakocra's hand immediately after a ranged attack.

traits.name: None
traits.text: None

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The cultist makes two Tentacle Lash attacks. It can replace any attack with a use of Mind Rot.

actions.name: Tentacle Lash
actions.text: Melee Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft. 7 (1d6 + 4) Slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) Psychic damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 14) from one of two tentacles, and it has the Restrained condition until the grapple ends.

actions.name: Mind Rot
actions.text: wis save DC 15, one creature the cultist can see within 90 feet. On a failed save, 27 (6d8) Psychic damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the start of the cultist's next turn. On a successful save, Half damage only.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.text:
The cultist casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):
At will: Detect Thoughts, Minor Illusion

reactions.name: Counterspell (2/Day)
reactions.text: The cultist casts Counterspell in response to that spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Eldritch Restoration
traits.text: If destroyed, the aboleth gains a new body in 5d10 days, reviving with all its Hit Points in the Far Realm or another location chosen by the DM.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
traits.text: If the aboleth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Mucus Cloud
traits.text:
While underwater, the aboleth is surrounded by mucus. con save DC 14, each creature in a 5-foot Emanation [Area of Effect] originating from the aboleth at the end of the aboleth's turn. On a failed save, The target is cursed. Until the curse ends, the target's skin becomes slimy, the target can breathe air and water, and it can't regain Hit Points unless it is underwater.
While the cursed creature is outside a body of water, the creature takes 6 (1d12) Acid damage at the end of every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to its skin before those minutes have passed.

traits.name: Probing Telepathy
traits.text: If a creature the aboleth can see communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The aboleth makes two Tentacle attacks and uses either Consume Memories or Dominate Mind if available.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.text: Melee Attack +9 to hit, reach 15 ft. 12 (2d6 + 5) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 14) from one of four tentacles.

actions.name: Consume Memories
actions.text: int save DC 16, one creature within 30 feet that is Charmed or Grappled by the aboleth. On a failed save, 10 (3d6) Psychic damage. On a successful save, Half damage. On a success or failure, The aboleth gains the target's memories if the target is a Humanoid and is reduced to 0 Hit Points by this action.

actions.name: Dominate Mind (2/Day)
actions.text:
wis save DC 16, one creature the aboleth can see within 30 feet. On a failed save, The target has the Charmed condition until the aboleth dies or is on a different plane of existence from the target. While Charmed, the target acts as an ally to the aboleth and is under its control while within 60 feet of it. In addition, the aboleth and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance.
The target repeats the save whenever it takes damage as well as after every 24 hours it spends at least 1 mile away from the aboleth, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary_actions.name: Legendary Actions
legendary_actions.text:
Legendary Action Uses: 3 (4 in Lair). Immediately after another creature's turn, The Aboleth can expend a use to take one of the following actions. The creature regains all expended uses at the start of each of its turns.

Lash. The aboleth makes one Tentacle attack.

Psychic Drain. If the aboleth has at least one creature Charmed or Grappled, it uses Consume Memories and regains 5 (1d10) Hit Points.

traits.name: Fear of Fire

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.text: Melee Attack +11 to hit, reach 5 ft. 14 (2d6 + 7) Slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) Cold damage.

actions.name: Ice Throw
actions.text: Ranged Attack +11 to hit, range 60/240 ft. 12 (2d4 + 7) Bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) Cold damage.

actions.name: Chilling Gaze
actions.text: con save DC 18, one creature the yeti can see within 30 feet. On a failed save, 21 (6d6) Cold damage, and the target has the Paralyzed condition until the start of the yeti's next turn unless the target has Immunity to Cold damage. On a successful save, The target is immune to this yeti's Chilling Gaze for 1 hour.

actions.name: Cold Breath (Recharge)

traits.name: Animal Lordship
traits.text: An animal lord represents a Forager, Hunter, or Sage (DM's choice), which determines certain traits in this stat block.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.text: If the animal lord fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Lordly Presence
traits.text:
wis save DC 20, any enemy that starts its turn in a 30-foot Emanation [Area of Effect] originating from the animal lord. On a failed save, The target suffers one of the following effects:
Captivated (Forager Only):
The target has the Charmed condition until the end of its next turn. While Charmed, the target has the Incapacitated condition.
Fearful (Hunter Only):
The target has the Frightened condition until the end of its next turn.
Mired (Sage Only):
The target takes 10 (3d6) Psychic damage, and the target is magically bewildered until the end of its next turn. While bewildered, the target subtracts 1d4 from its saving throws.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The animal lord has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The animal lord makes two attacks, using Rend or Radiant Ray in any combination, and uses Animal Spirit.

actions.name: Rend
actions.text: Melee Attack +13 to hit, reach 5 ft. 14 (2d6 + 7) Slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) Force damage.

actions.name: Radiant Ray
actions.text: Ranged Attack +12 to hit, range 120 ft. 20 (4d6 + 6) Radiant damage.

actions.name: Animal Spirit
actions.text:
The animal lord conjures an animal spirit that strikes at a creature and then disappears. dex save DC 20, one creature the animal lord can see within 120 feet. On a failed save, 28 (4d10 + 6) Radiant damage. On a successful save, Half damage. On a success or failure, One of the following effects occurs:
Fortify (Forager Only):
The animal lord gains 20 Temporary Hit Points.
Marked as Prey (Hunter Only):
The animal lord has Advantage on attack rolls against the target until the start of the animal lord's next turn.
Pesky Swarm (Sage Only):
The target has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.text:
The animal lord casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 20):
At will: Animal Friendship, Animal Messenger, Speak with Animals
2/day: Awaken, Greater Restoration
1/day: Animal Shapes, Sunburst

bonus_actions.name: Shape-Shift
bonus_actions.text: The animal lord shape-shifts into a Huge or smaller version of the animal it represents or a Medium or Small Humanoid, or it returns to its true form. Its game statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

Radiant Strike. The animal lord makes one Radiant Ray attack.

The rug can smother only one creature at a time.
While grappling the target, the rug can't take this action, the rug halves the damage it takes (round down), and the target takes the same amount of damage.

traits.name: Fiendish Restoration
traits.text: If the arcanaloth dies outside Gehenna, its body dissolves into ichor, and it gains a new body instantly and revives with all its Hit Points in Gehenna.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The arcanaloth has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Soul Tome
traits.text:
The arcanaloth has a magic tome. While holding or carrying the tome, the arcanaloth can use its Banishing Claw action.
The tome has AC 17; HP 35; and Immunity to Necrotic, Poison, and Psychic damage. The tome regains all its Hit Points at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points or when the arcanaloth dies. If the tome is destroyed, the arcanaloth can create a new one when it finishes a Short Rest or Long Rest.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The arcanaloth makes three Fiendish Burst attacks. It can replace one attack with a Banishing Claw attack.

actions.name: Fiendish Burst
actions.text: Melee or Ranged Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft. 31 (4d12 + 5) Necrotic damage.

actions.name: Banishing Claw (Requires Soul Tome)
actions.text:
Melee Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. 10 (2d4 + 5) Slashing damage plus 19 (3d12) Psychic damage. If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect. cha save DC 17. On a failed save, The target is trapped in a demiplane inside the Soul Tome. While trapped there, the target has the Incapacitated condition. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, escaping the tome on a success. When the target escapes, it appears in the space it left or, if that space is occupied, the nearest unoccupied space.
If the target fails three of these saves while in the demiplane, it becomes bound to the tome and can escape only if the tome is reduced to 0 Hit Points.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.text:
The arcanaloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):
At will: Alter Self, Detect Magic, Identify, Mage Hand, Prestidigitation
1/day: Contact Other Plane, Detect Thoughts, Dimension Door, Mind Blank

bonus_actions.name: Teleport
bonus_actions.text: The arcanaloth teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

reactions.name: Counterspell
reactions.text: The arcanaloth casts Counterspell in response to that spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

traits.text: If the hag fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.text: The hag has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Spiteful Escape
traits.text: When the hag drops to 0 Hit Points, it dies only if it is within 30 feet of its anathema (a thing the DM chooses as the hag's most hated thing). Otherwise, the hag drops to 1 Hit Points and teleports to a harmless demiplane, and it can't return to the plane it left for 2d6 days. When the hag teleports away, each creature within 60 feet of the space it left is cursed. Until the curse ends, a creature has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws, and the hag knows its location anywhere in the multiverse.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The hag makes two Spectral Claw attacks and uses Crackling Wave.

actions.name: Spectral Claw
actions.text: Melee or Ranged Attack +14 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 60 ft. 17 (3d6 + 7) Force damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

actions.name: Crackling Wave
actions.text: dex save DC 22, each creature in a 60-foot Cone [Area of Effect]. On a failed save, 32 (5d12) Lightning damage. On a successful save, Half damage. On a success or failure, The target is cursed until the end of the hag's next turn. The target can't take Reactions until the curse ends.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.text:
The hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 22):
At will: Detect Thoughts, Dimension Door, Dispel Magic, Hypnotic Pattern
2/day: Mass Suggestion, Modify Memory, Plane Shift

bonus_actions.name: Witch Strike
bonus_actions.text: Each creature cursed by the hag and within 60 feet of it takes 14 (4d6) Lightning damage.

reactions.name: Tongue Twister
reactions.text: The hag casts Counterspell in response to that spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting. If the target fails its saving throw, it is cursed until the end of its next turn. Until the curse ends, the target can't cast spells with a Verbal component, and when it speaks, it says the opposite of what it means.

legendary_actions.name: Legendary Actions
legendary_actions.text:
Legendary Action Uses: 3 (4 in Lair). Immediately after another creature's turn, The Arch-hag can expend a use to take one of the following actions. The creature regains all expended uses at the start of each of its turns.

Hag's Swipe. The hag makes one Spectral Claw attack.

Malicious Magic. The hag uses Spellcasting to cast Dimension Door or Hypnotic Pattern. The hag can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

actions.text: Melee Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. 14 (3d6 + 4) Piercing damage.

2/day: Fly, Lightning Bolt (level 7 version)
1/day: Cone of Cold (level 9 version), Mind Blank (cast before combat), Scrying, Teleport

reactions.name: Protective Magic (3/Day)
reactions.text: The archmage casts Counterspell or Shield in response to the spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

actions.name: Lightning Blade
actions.text: Melee Attack +14 to hit, reach 10 ft. 21 (3d8 + 8) Force damage plus 22 (4d10) Lightning damage, and the target can't take Reactions until the start of the balor's next turn.

name: Banshee
immunity: cold, necrotic, poison, charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Detect Life
traits.text: The banshee magically senses the direction of creatures up to 1 mile away that aren't Constructs or Undead.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.text: The banshee can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The banshee makes two Corrupting Touch attacks and uses Horrify.

actions.name: Corrupting Touch
actions.text: Melee Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. 7 (1d8 + 3) Necrotic damage.

actions.name: Horrify
actions.text: wis save DC 13, one creature the banshee can see within 60 feet that can see the banshee. On a failed save, The target has the Frightened condition until the start of the banshee's next turn. On a successful save, The target is immune to this banshee's Horrify for 24 hours.

actions.name: Deathly Wail (1/Day)
actions.text: The banshee releases a mournful wail if it isn't in sunlight. con save DC 13, each creature within 30 feet that can hear the wail and isn't a Construct or an Undead. On a failed save, If the target has 25 Hit Points or fewer, it drops to 0 Hit Points. Otherwise, the target takes 10 (3d6) Psychic damage.

traits.name: Barbed Hide
traits.text: At the start of each of its turns, the devil deals 5 (1d10) Piercing damage to any creature it is grappling or any creature grappling it.

traits.name: Diabolical Restoration
traits.text: If the devil dies outside the Nine Hells, its body disappears in sulfurous smoke, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Nine Hells.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The devil has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The devil makes one Claws attack and one Tail attack, or it makes two Hurl Flame attacks.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. 10 (2d6 + 3) Piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 13) from both claws.

actions.name: Tail
actions.text: Melee Attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft. 14 (2d10 + 3) Slashing damage.

actions.name: Hurl Flame
actions.text: Ranged Attack +5 to hit, range 150 ft. 17 (5d6) Fire damage. If the target is a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried, it starts Burning Hazard.

traits.name: Demonic Restoration
traits.text: If the barlgura dies outside the Abyss, its body dissolves into ichor, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Abyss.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The barlgura makes one Tormenting Bite attack and two Thrash attacks.

actions.name: Tormenting Bite
actions.text: Melee Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. 11 (2d6 + 4) Piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) Psychic damage.

actions.name: Thrash
actions.text: Melee Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. 9 (1d10 + 4) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.text:
The barlgura casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
2/day: Disguise Self, Invisibility (self only)
1/day: Entangle, Phantasmal Killer (level 6 version)

bonus_actions.name: Leap
bonus_actions.text: The barlgura jumps up to 40 feet by spending 10 feet of movement.

traits.text: None

actions.text: Melee Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. 10 (2d6 + 3) Piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) Poison damage.

bonus_actions.name: Petrifying Gaze (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.text: con save DC 12, each creature in a 30-foot Cone [Area of Effect]. If the basilisk sees its reflection within the Cone [Area of Effect], the basilisk must make this save. On a failed save (1): The target has the Restrained condition and repeats the save at the end of its next turn if it is still Restrained, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a failed save (2): The target has the Petrified condition instead of the Restrained condition.

traits.text: None

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee Attack +4 to hit to hit, reach 5 ft. 1 Piercing damage.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The devil has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.name: Beard
actions.text: Melee Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. 7 (1d8 + 3) Piercing damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the start of the devil's next turn. Until this poison ends, the target can't regain Hit Points.

actions.name: Infernal Glaive
actions.text: Melee Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft. 8 (1d10 + 3) Slashing damage. If the target is a creature and doesn't already have an infernal wound, it is subjected to the following effect. con save DC 12. On a failed save, The target receives an infernal wound. While wounded, the target loses 5 (1d10) Hit Points at the start of each of its turns. The wound closes after 1 minute, after a spell restores Hit Points to the target, or after the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to stanch the wound, doing so by succeeding on a DC 12 Wisdom (Medicine skill) check.

traits.name: None
traits.text: None

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The behir makes one Bite attack and uses Constrict.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee Attack +10 to hit, reach 10 ft. 19 (2d12 + 6) Piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) Lightning damage.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.text: str save DC 18, one Large or smaller creature the behir can see within 5 feet. On a failed save, 28 (5d8 + 6) Bludgeoning damage. The target has the Grappled condition (escape DC 16), and it has the Restrained condition until the grapple ends.

actions.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.text: dex save DC 16, each creature in a 90-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line [Area of Effect]. On a failed save, 66 (12d10) Lightning damage. On a successful save, Half damage.

bonus_actions.name: Swallow
bonus_actions.text:
dex save DC 18, one Large or smaller creature Grappled by the behir (the behir can have only one creature swallowed at a time). On a failed save, The behir swallows the target, which is no longer Grappled. While swallowed, a creature has the Blinded and Restrained conditions, has Cover against attacks and other effects outside the behir, and takes 21 (6d6) Acid damage at the start of each of the behir's turns.
If the behir takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the behir must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls in a space within 10 feet of the behir and has the Prone condition. If the behir dies, a swallowed creature is no longer Restrained and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting Prone.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
traits.text: If the beholder fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The beholder uses Eye Rays three times.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. 13 (3d6 + 3) Piercing damage.

actions.name: Eye Rays
actions.text:
The beholder randomly shoots one of the following magical rays at a target it can see within 120 feet of itself (roll 1d10; reroll if the beholder has already used that ray during this turn):
1: Charm Ray:
wis save DC 16. On a failed save, 13 (3d8) Psychic damage, and the target has the Charmed condition for 1 hour or until it takes damage. On a successful save, Half damage only.
2: Paralyzing Ray:
con save DC 16. On a failed save, The target has the Paralyzed condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.
3: Fear Ray:
wis save DC 16. On a failed save, 14 (4d6) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, Half damage only.
4: Slowing Ray:
con save DC 16. On a failed save, 18 (4d8) Necrotic damage. Until the end of the target's next turn, the target's Speed is halved; the target can't take Reactions; and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. On a successful save, Half damage only.
5: Enervation Ray:
con save DC 16. On a failed save, 13 (3d8) Poison damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn. While Poisoned, the target can't regain Hit Points. On a successful save, Half damage only.
6: Telekinetic Ray:
str save DC 16 (the target succeeds automatically if it is Gargantuan). On a failed save, The beholder moves the target up to 30 feet in any direction. The target has the Restrained condition until the start of the beholder's next turn or until the beholder has the Incapacitated condition. The beholder can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a tool or opening a door or container.
7: Sleep Ray:
wis save DC 16 (the target succeeds automatically if it is a Construct or an Undead). On a failed save, The target has the Unconscious condition for 1 minute. The condition ends if the target takes damage or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to wake it.
8: Petrification Ray:
con save DC 16. On a failed save (1): The target has the Restrained condition and repeats the save at the end of its next turn if it is still Restrained, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a failed save (2): The target has the Petrified condition instead of the Restrained condition.
9: Disintegration Ray:
dex save DC 16. On a failed save, 36 (8d8) Force damage. If the target is a nonmagical object or a creation of magical force, a 10-foot Cube [Area of Effect] of it disintegrates into dust. On a successful save, Half damage. On a success or failure, If the target is a creature and this damage reduces it to 0 Hit Points, it disintegrates into dust.
10: Death Ray:
dex save DC 16. On a failed save, 55 (10d10) Necrotic damage. On a successful save, Half damage. On a success or failure, The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 Hit Points.

bonus_actions.name: Antimagic Cone
bonus_actions.text: The beholder's central eye emits an antimagic wave in a 150-foot Cone [Area of Effect]. Until the start of the beholder's next turn, that area acts as an Antimagic Field spell, and that area works against the beholder's own Eye Rays.

legendary_actions.name: Legendary Actions
legendary_actions.text:
Legendary Action Uses: 3 (4 in Lair). Immediately after another creature's turn, The Beholder can expend a use to take one of the following actions. The creature regains all expended uses at the start of each of its turns.

Chomp. The beholder makes two Bite attacks.

Glare. The beholder uses Eye Rays.

name: Beholder Zombie

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The zombie uses Eye Rays twice.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. 16 (4d6 + 2) Piercing damage.

actions.name: Eye Rays
actions.text:
The zombie randomly shoots one of the following magical rays at a target it can see within 120 feet of itself (roll 1d4; reroll if the zombie has already used that ray during this turn):
1: Paralyzing Ray:
con save DC 14. On a failed save, The target has the Paralyzed condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.
2: Fear Ray:
wis save DC 14. On a failed save, 13 (3d8) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the end of its next turn.
3: Enervation Ray:
con save DC 14. On a failed save, 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn. While Poisoned, the target can't regain Hit Points. On a successful save, Half damage only.
4: Disintegration Ray:
dex save DC 14. On a failed save, 27 (5d10) Force damage. If the target is a nonmagical object or a creation of magical force, a 10-foot Cube [Area of Effect] of it disintegrates into dust. On a successful save, Half damage. On a success or failure, If the target is a creature and this damage reduces it to 0 Hit Points, it disintegrates into dust.

traits.name: Bloodied Frenzy

actions.text: Melee Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. 9 (1d12 + 3) Slashing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Frenzied Rush
bonus_actions.text: Each ally within 30 feet of the berserker can take a Reaction to move up to half the ally's Speed without provoking Opportunity Attack. The berserker can also move up to half its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attack.

actions.name: Rend
actions.text: Melee Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. 5 (1d6 + 2) Slashing damage.

traits.text: The Dragon can breathe air and water.

actions.text: dex save DC 11, each creature in a 15-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line [Area of Effect]. On a failed save, 22 (5d8) Acid damage. On a successful save, Half damage.

name: Black Pudding
immunity: acid, cold, lightning, slashing, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, prone, restrained

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.text: The pudding can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

traits.name: Corrosive Form
traits.text:
A creature that hits the pudding with a melee attack roll takes 4 (1d8) Acid damage. Nonmagical ammunition is destroyed immediately after hitting the pudding and dealing any damage. Any nonmagical weapon takes a cumulative -1 penalty to attack rolls immediately after dealing damage to the pudding and coming into contact with it. The weapon is destroyed if the penalty reaches -5. The penalty can be removed by casting the Mending spell on the weapon.
In 1 minute, the pudding can eat through 2 feet of nonmagical wood or metal.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The pudding can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Dissolving Pseudopod
actions.text: Melee Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft. 17 (4d6 + 3) Acid damage. Nonmagical armor worn by the target takes a -1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10. The penalty can be removed by casting the Mending spell on the armor.

reactions.name: Split
reactions.text: Trigger: While the pudding is Large or Medium and has 10+ Hit Points, it becomes Bloodied or is subjected to Lightning or Slashing damage. Response: The pudding splits into two new Black Puddings. Each new pudding is one size smaller than the original pudding and acts on its Initiative. The original pudding's Hit Points are divided evenly between the new puddings (round down).

name: Blob of Annihilation
immunity: acid, necrotic, poison, charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, stunned, unconscious

traits.name: Astral Implosion
traits.text: If the blob is reduced to 0 Hit Points, it implodes and ejects any creatures and objects engulfed by it into the Astral Sea. The blob itself vanishes, leaving behind a layer of slime on everything that was within 600 feet of it. In 1d20 years, the blob reconstitutes on a random world in the Material Plane.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.text: If the blob fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The blob has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The blob makes two Pseudopod attacks and uses Engulf. It can replace one attack with a use of Restraining Glob.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.text: Melee Attack +15 to hit, reach 30 ft. 24 (3d10 + 8) Force damage.

actions.name: Engulf
actions.text:
The blob moves up to its Speed and can move through the spaces of Huge or smaller creatures and objects. str save DC 23, each creature or object whose space the blob enters for the first time during this move. On a failed save, The target is engulfed. While engulfed, a target has Cover against attacks and other effects outside the blob, and when the blob moves, the engulfed target moves with it. A nonmagical object is destroyed after spending 1 minute engulfed.
While engulfed, a creature takes 21 (6d6) Force damage at the start of each of its turns, is suffocating, has the Restrained condition, and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns. An engulfed creature that is reduced to 0 Hit Points dissolves into ash, which is ejected into the Astral Sea. On a successful save, The target escapes and enters the nearest unoccupied space.

actions.name: Restraining Glob
actions.text: The blob lobs a slimy glob at one Large or smaller creature it can see within 600 feet of itself. dex save DC 23, the targeted creature. On a failed save, 18 (3d6 + 8) Acid damage. The glob rolls the target 60 feet straight toward the blob, and the target has the Restrained condition until the end of its next turn, when the glob harmlessly dissolves. On a successful save, Half damage only.

legendary_actions.name: Legendary Actions
legendary_actions.text:
Legendary Action Uses: 3. Immediately after another creature's turn, The Blob of Annihilation can expend a use to take one of the following actions. The creature regains all expended uses at the start of each of its turns.

Decay. The blob deals 14 (4d6) Necrotic damage to each creature engulfed by it. The blob can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Grasping Glob. The blob uses Restraining Glob. The blob can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Lashing Goop. The blob makes one Pseudopod attack.

The cursed target can't regain Hit Points, and its Hit Points maximum decreases by 10 (3d6) after every 24 hours and doesn't return to normal after finishing a Long Rest. If the curse reduces the target's Hit Points maximum to 0, the curse ends, and instead of dying, the target instantly transforms into a Red Slaad or, if it can cast spells of level 3 or higher, a Green Slaad. Only a Wish spell can reverse this transformation.

traits.name: Earth Glide

traits.text: The dao has a 30 percent chance of knowing the Wish spell. If the dao knows it, the dao can cast it only on behalf of a non-genie creature who communicates a wish in a way the dao can understand. If the dao casts the spell for the creature, the dao suffers none of the spell's stress. Once the dao has cast it three times, the dao can't do so again for 365 days.

Earth explodes from the target's space, creating the following effect. dex save DC 16, each creature in a 10-foot Emanation [Area of Effect] originating from and including the target. Melee Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. 6 (1d6 + 3) Bludgeoning damage, and the darkmantle attaches to the target. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature and the darkmantle had Advantage on the attack roll, it covers the target, which has the Blinded condition and is suffocating while the darkmantle is attached in this way.
While attached to a target, the darkmantle can attack only the target but has Advantage on its attack rolls. Its Speed becomes 0, it can't benefit from any bonus to its Speed, and it moves with the target.
A creature can take an action to try to detach the darkmantle from itself, doing so with a successful DC 13 Strength (Athletics skill) check. On its turn, the darkmantle can detach itself by using 5 feet of movement.

actions.name: Darkness Aura (1/Day)
actions.text: Magical Darkness fills a 15-foot Emanation [Area of Effect] originating from the darkmantle. This effect lasts while the darkmantle maintains Concentration on it, up to 10 minutes. Darkvision can't penetrate this area, and no light can illuminate it.

Subsequent Failures: The Poisoned target's Hit Points maximum decreases by 5 (1d10).

traits.name: Undead Restoration

Legendary Action Uses: 3. Immediately after another creature's turn, The Death Knight can expend a use to take one of the following actions. The creature regains all expended uses at the start of each of its turns.

On a failed save, 17 (5d6) Necrotic damage, and the target's Hit Points maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken. On a success or failure, The death knight can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Lunge. The death knight moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one Dread Blade attack.

bonus_actions.name: Shape-Shift
bonus_actions.text: The slaad shape-shifts into a Small or Medium Humanoid, or it returns to its true form. Other than its size, its game statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

name: Death Tyrant
immunity: poison, charmed, exhaustion, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
traits.text: If the death tyrant fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The death tyrant uses Eye Rays three times.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 feet. 13 (2d8 + 4) Piercing damage.

actions.name: Eye Rays
actions.text:
The death tyrant randomly shoots one of the following magical rays at a target it can see within 120 feet of itself (roll 1d10; reroll if the death tyrant has already used that ray during this turn):
1: Charm Ray:
wis save DC 17. On a failed save, 13 (3d8) Psychic damage, and the target has the Charmed condition for 1 hour or until it takes damage. On a successful save, Half damage only.
2: Paralyzing Ray:
con save DC 17. On a failed save, The target has the Paralyzed condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.
3: Fear Ray:
wis save DC 17. On a failed save, 10 (3d6) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, Half damage only.
4: Slowing Ray:
con save DC 17. On a failed save, 18 (4d8) Necrotic damage. Until the end of the target's next turn, the target can't take Reactions; its Speed is halved; and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. On a successful save, Half damage only.
5: Enervation Ray:
con save DC 17. On a failed save, 16 (3d10) Poison damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn. While Poisoned, the target can't regain Hit Points. On a successful save, Half damage only.
6: Telekinetic Ray:
str save DC 17 (the target succeeds automatically if it is Gargantuan). On a failed save, The death tyrant moves the target up to 30 feet in any direction. The target has the Restrained condition until the start of the death tyrant's next turn or until the death tyrant has the Incapacitated condition. The death tyrant can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a tool or opening a door or container.
7: Sleep Ray:
wis save DC 17 (the target succeeds automatically if it is a Construct or an Undead). On a failed save, The target has the Unconscious condition for 1 minute. The condition ends if the target takes damage or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to wake it.
8: Petrification Ray:
con save DC 17. On a failed save (1): The target has the Restrained condition and repeats the save at the end of its next turn if it is still Restrained, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a failed save (2): The target has the Petrified condition instead of the Restrained condition.
9: Disintegration Ray:
dex save DC 17. On a failed save, 36 (8d8) Force damage. If the target is a nonmagical object or a creation of magical force, a 10-foot Cube [Area of Effect] of it disintegrates into dust. On a successful save, Half damage. On a success or failure, If the target is a creature and this damage reduces it to 0 Hit Points, it disintegrates into dust.
10: Death Ray:
dex save DC 17. On a failed save, 55 (10d10) Necrotic damage. On a successful save, Half damage. On a success or failure, The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 Hit Points.

bonus_actions.name: Negative Energy Cone
bonus_actions.text: The death tyrant's central eye emits an imperceptible, magical wave of negative energy in a 150-foot Cone [Area of Effect]. Creatures in that area can't regain Hit Points until the start of the death tyrant's next turn. An intact Humanoid corpse there instantly rises as a Zombie under the death tyrant's control and takes its turn immediately after the death tyrant on the same initiative count.

legendary_actions.name: Legendary Actions
legendary_actions.text:
Legendary Action Uses: 3 (4 in Lair). Immediately after another creature's turn, The Death Tyrant can expend a use to take one of the following actions. The creature regains all expended uses at the start of each of its turns.

Chomp. The death tyrant makes two Bite attacks.

Glare. The death tyrant uses Eye Rays.

traits.name: Wishes
traits.text: The djinni has a 30 percent chance of knowing the Wish spell. If the djinni knows it, the djinni can cast it only on behalf of a non-genie creature who communicates a wish in a way the djinni can understand. If the djinni casts the spell for the creature, the djinni suffers none of the spell's stress. Once the djinni has cast it three times, the djinni can't do so again for 365 days.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The djinni makes three attacks, using Storm Blade or Storm Bolt in any combination.

actions.name: Storm Blade
actions.text: Melee Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 feet. 12 (2d6 + 5) Slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) Lightning damage.

actions.name: Storm Bolt
actions.text: Ranged Attack +9 to hit, range 120 feet. 13 (3d8) Thunder damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

actions.name: Create Whirlwind
actions.text:
The djinni conjures a whirlwind at a point it can see within 120 feet. The whirlwind fills a 20-foot-radius, 60-foot-high Cylinder [Area of Effect] centered on that point. The whirlwind lasts until the djinni's Concentration on it ends. The djinni can move the whirlwind up to 20 feet at the start of each of its turns.
Whenever the whirlwind enters a creature's space or a creature enters the whirlwind, that creature is subjected to the following effect. str save DC 17 (a creature makes this save only once per turn, and the djinni is unaffected). On a failed save, While in the whirlwind, the target has the Restrained condition and moves with the whirlwind. At the start of each of its turns, the Restrained target takes 21 (6d6) Thunder damage. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.text:
The djinni casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):
At will: Detect Evil and Good, Detect Magic
2/day: Create Food and Water (can create wine instead of water), Tongues, Wind Walk
1/day: Creation, Gaseous Form, Invisibility, Major Image, Plane Shift

traits.name: None
traits.text: None

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The doppelganger makes two Slam attacks and uses Unsettling Visage if available.

actions.name: Slam
actions.text: Melee Attack +6 to hit (with Advantage during the first round of each combat), reach 5 ft. 11 (2d6 + 4) Bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Unsettling Visage (Recharge)
actions.text: wis save DC 12, each creature in a 15-foot Emanation [Area of Effect] originating from the doppelganger that can see the doppelganger. On a failed save, The target has the Frightened condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.text:
The doppelganger casts Detect Thoughts, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12).
At will: Detect Thoughts

bonus_actions.name: Shape-Shift
bonus_actions.text: The doppelganger shape-shifts into a Medium or Small Humanoid, or it returns to its true form. Its game statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

name: Dracolich
immunity: necrotic, poison, charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
traits.text: If the dracolich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Life Suppression
traits.text: Creatures within 60 feet of the dracolich can't regain Hit Points.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The dracolich has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Soul Gem
traits.text:
The dracolich has a magical gem. If the dracolich is destroyed while the gem is on the same plane of existence as it, the dracolich gains a new body in 1d20 days, regaining all its Hit Points and appearing within 5 feet of the gem.
The gem is a Tiny object that has AC 20; HP 50; and Immunity to Necrotic, Poison, and Psychic damage. The gem regains all its Hit Points at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points. If the gem is destroyed, the dracolich can create a new one by completing an 8-hour ritual using a gem worth 1,000+ GP and by expending 5,000 GP, which the ritual consumes.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The dracolich makes three Rend attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting to cast Ray of Sickness (level 2 version).

actions.name: Rend
actions.text: Melee Attack +13 to hit, reach 10 ft. 18 (2d10 + 7) Slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) Necrotic damage.

actions.name: Necrotic Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.text: con save DC 20, each creature in a 60-foot Cone [Area of Effect]. On a failed save, 52 (8d12) Necrotic damage. On a successful save, Half damage.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.text:
The dracolich casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 19, +11 to hit to hit with spell attacks):
At will: Detect Magic, Ray of Sickness (level 2 version)
1/day: Create Undead (level 8 version), Finger of Death

legendary_actions.name: Legendary Actions
legendary_actions.text:
Legendary Action Uses: 3 (4 in Lair). Immediately after another creature's turn, The Dracolich can expend a use to take one of the following actions. The creature regains all expended uses at the start of each of its turns.

Pounce. The dracolich moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one Rend attack.

Sickening Ray. The dracolich uses Spellcasting to cast Ray of Sickness (level 2 version). The dracolich can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Terrifying Presence. wis save DC 19, each creature in a 30-foot Emanation [Area of Effect] originating from the dracolich. On a failed save, 11 (2d10) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the end of its next turn. On a success or failure, The dracolich can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: None

traits.name: Amphibious

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee Attack +13 to hit, reach 15 ft. 23 (3d10 + 7) Piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) Fire damage. Being underwater doesn't grant Resistance to this Fire damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.text: Melee Attack +13 to hit, reach 15 ft. 18 (2d10 + 7) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

actions.name: Steam Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.text: con save DC 19, each creature in a 60-foot Cone [Area of Effect]. On a failed save, 56 (16d6) Fire damage. On a successful save, Half damage. On a success or failure, Being underwater doesn't grant Resistance to this Fire damage.

actions.name: Fetid Cloud (1/Day)
actions.text: con save DC 11, each creature in a 10-foot Emanation [Area of Effect] originating from the dretch. On a failed save, The target has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn. While Poisoned, the creature can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both, and it can't take Reactions.

traits.text: The drider can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Web Walker

actions.name: Poison Burst
actions.text: Ranged Attack +6 to hit, range 120 ft. 13 (3d6 + 3) Poison damage.

traits.name: None

actions.text: Melee Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. 7 (1d8 + 3) Bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) Poison damage.

actions.name: Verdant Wisp
actions.text: Ranged Attack +5 to hit, range 90 ft. 10 (3d6) Radiant damage.

2/day: Entangle, Thunderwave

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The dryad has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
traits.text: The dryad can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if they shared a language.

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.name: Thorn Burst
actions.text: Ranged Attack +6 to hit, range 60 ft. 7 (1d6 + 4) Piercing damage.

actions.name: Spellcasting

The dryad casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):
At will: Animal Friendship, Charm Monster (lasts 24 hours; ends early if the dryad casts the spell again), Druidcraft
1/day: Entangle, Pass without Trace

bonus_actions.name: Tree Stride
bonus_actions.text: If within 5 feet of a Large or bigger tree, the dryad teleports to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of a second Large or bigger tree that is within 60 feet of the previous tree.

traits.name: Death Burst
traits.text: The mephit explodes when it dies. dex save DC 10, each creature in a 5-foot Emanation [Area of Effect] originating from the mephit. On a failed save, 5 (2d4) Bludgeoning damage. On a successful save, Half damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. 4 (1d4 + 2) Slashing damage.

actions.name: Blinding Breath (Recharge)
actions.text: dex save DC 10, each creature in a 15-foot Cone [Area of Effect]. On a failed save, The target has the Blinded condition until the end of the mephit's next turn.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.text:
The mephit casts the Sleep spell, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 10).
1/day: Sleep

actions.text: Melee Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 feet. 4 (1d4 + 2) Slashing damage.

traits.name: Earth Glide
traits.text: The Elemental can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the Elemental doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

traits.name: Siege Monster

traits.name: Elemental Restoration
traits.text: If the efreeti dies outside the Elemental Plane of Fire, its body dissolves into ash, and it gains a new body in 1d4 days, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere on the Plane of Fire.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The efreeti has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Wishes
traits.text: The efreeti has a 30 percent chance of knowing the Wish spell. If the efreeti knows it, the efreeti can cast it only on behalf of a non-genie creature who communicates a wish in a way the efreeti can understand. If the efreeti casts the spell for the creature, the efreeti suffers none of the spell's stress. Once the efreeti has cast it three times, the efreeti can't do so again for 365 days.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The efreeti makes three attacks, using Heated Blade or Hurl Flame in any combination.

actions.name: Heated Blade
actions.text: Melee Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft. 13 (2d6 + 6) Slashing damage plus 13 (2d12) Fire damage.

actions.name: Hurl Flame
actions.text: Ranged Attack +8 to hit, range 120 ft. 24 (7d6) Fire damage.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.text:
The efreeti casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):

1/day: Gaseous Form, Invisibility, Major Image, Plane Shift, Tongues, Wall of Fire (level 7 version)

name: Elemental Cataclysm
immunity: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, thunder, blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, stunned, unconscious

traits.name: Earth Glide
traits.text: The cataclysm can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the cataclysm doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.text: If the cataclysm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The cataclysm deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The cataclysm makes two Elemental Burst attacks.

actions.name: Elemental Burst
actions.text: Melee or Ranged Attack +15 to hit, reach 30 ft. or range 150 ft. 25 (5d6 + 8) damage of a type chosen by the cataclysm: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder.

actions.name: Cataclysmic Event (Recharge 4-6)
actions.text:
The cataclysm creates one of the following effects at random (roll 1d4):
1: Clinging Flames:
dex save DC 23, each creature in a 60-foot-radius Sphere [Area of Effect] centered on a point the cataclysm can see within 150 feet. On a failed save, 45 (13d6) Fire damage. On a successful save, Half damage. On a success or failure, The target starts Burning Hazard.
2: Freezing Waves:
str save DC 23, each creature in a 90-foot Cone [Area of Effect]. On a failed save, 22 (5d8) Bludgeoning damage plus 22 (5d8) Cold damage, and the target has the Prone condition. On a successful save, Half damage only. On a success or failure, The target's Speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn.
3: Raging Storm:
A storm cloud fills a 60-foot-radius Sphere [Area of Effect] centered on a point the cataclysm can see within 150 feet. The cloud lasts for 1 minute or until the cataclysm uses Cataclysmic Event again. Creatures entirely in the cloud have the Blinded and Deafened conditions and can't cast spells with a Verbal component. dex save DC 23, each creature that enters the cloud for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there. On a failed save, 18 (4d8) Lightning damage plus 18 (4d8) Thunder damage. On a successful save, Half damage.
4: Swallowing Earth:
str save DC 23, each creature in a 90-foot Cube [Area of Effect] originating from a point on the ground within 150 feet. On a failed save, 18 (4d8) Bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) Acid damage, and the target has the Prone condition and is buried under rubble. A buried target has the Restrained condition, has Cover, and is suffocating. As an action, a buried creature or another creature within 5 feet of it can make a DC 18 Strength (Athletics skill) check. On a successful check, the creature is no longer buried. On a successful save, Half damage only.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.text:
The cataclysm casts the Control Weather spell, requiring no spell components and using Constitution as the spellcasting ability.
At will: Control Weather

legendary_actions.name: Legendary Actions
legendary_actions.text:
Legendary Action Uses: 3. Immediately after another creature's turn, The Elemental Cataclysm can expend a use to take one of the following actions. The creature regains all expended uses at the start of each of its turns.

Eruption. The cataclysm makes one Elemental Burst attack.

Rumbling Movement. The cataclysm moves up to its Speed, Fly Speed, or Swim Speed without provoking Opportunity Attack. Each creature within 5 feet of the cataclysm as it moves is targeted once by the following effect. con save DC 23. On a failed save, The target has the Prone condition. On a success or failure, The cataclysm can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

bonus_actions.text: dex save DC 16, one creature within 5 feet that has the Prone condition. On a failed save, 17 (2d10 + 6) Bludgeoning damage. On a successful save, Half damage.

Bolster. The empyrean gains 10 Temporary Hit Points, and the empyrean and each ally within 30 feet of it gain Advantage on D20 Test until the end of the empyrean's next turn. The empyrean can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Shockwave of Glory. con save DC 23, each creature in a 30-foot Emanation [Area of Effect] originating from the empyrean. On a failed save, 27 (6d8) Force damage, and the target has the Prone condition. On a successful save, Half damage only. On a success or failure, The empyrean can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Smite. The empyrean makes one Divine Ray attack.

The rope turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points, if it is 5+ feet away from the erinyes for 1 hour or more, or if the erinyes dies. If the rope is damaged or destroyed, the erinyes can fully restore it when finishing a Short Rest or Long Rest.

actions.name: Multiattack

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.text: Trigger: The erinyes is hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon. Response: The erinyes adds 4 to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

immunity: lightning, poison, charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
languages: understands Common plus one other language but can't speak

traits.name: Aversion to Fire
traits.text: If the golem takes Fire damage, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Berserk
traits.text:
Whenever the golem starts its turn Bloodied, roll 1d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object. Once the golem goes berserk, it remains so until it is destroyed or it is no longer Bloodied.
The golem's creator, if within 60 feet of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by taking an action to make a DC 15 Charisma (Persuasion skill) check; the golem must be able to hear its creator. If this check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk until the start of its next turn, at which point it resumes rolling for the Berserk trait again if it is still Bloodied.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The golem can't shape-shift.

traits.name: Lightning Absorption
traits.text: Whenever the golem is subjected to Lightning damage, it regains a number of Hit Points equal to the Lightning damage dealt.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The golem has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The golem makes two Slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.text: Melee Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. 13 (2d8 + 4) Bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) Lightning damage.

traits.name: Prone Deficiency
traits.text: If the flumph receives the Prone condition, roll a die. On an odd number, it has the Incapacitated condition. At the end of each of its turns, the flumph makes a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw, ending the Incapacitated condition on a success.

traits.name: Telepathic Shroud
traits.text: The flumph's thoughts can't be read by any means, and magic can't detect its location or observe it remotely.

Other creatures have the Poisoned condition while in a 5-foot Emanation [Area of Effect] originating from the coated target. The target can remove the stench on itself if it bathes during a Short Rest or Long Rest.

actions.text: The galeb duhr magically animates one or two boulders it can see within 60 feet of itself. The boulder takes its turn immediately after the galeb duhr on the same Initiative count, and it obeys the galeb duhr. A boulder remains animate for 1 minute or until it or the galeb duhr dies.

traits.name: Death Burst

On a failed save, The target takes 10 (3d6) Poison damage and has the Poisoned condition for 1d12 hours. Unless the Poisoned condition is removed, the target dies at the end of that time and sprouts 2d4 Tiny Gas Spore Fungi (each with 1 Hit Points). After 2d6 days, they become Large and have 13 Hit Points.

actions.name: Tendril
actions.text: Melee Attack +0 to hit, reach 5 ft. 3 (1d6) Poison damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn.

name: Gelatinous Cube
immunity: acid, blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, prone

traits.name: Ooze Cube
traits.text:
The cube fills its entire space and is transparent. Other creatures can enter that space, but a creature that does so is subjected to the cube's Engulf and has Disadvantage on the saving throw.
Creatures inside the cube have Cover, and the cube can hold one Large creature or up to four Medium or Small creatures inside itself at a time.
As an action, a creature within 5 feet of the cube can pull a creature or an object out of the cube by succeeding on a DC 12 Strength (Athletics skill) check, and the puller takes 10 (3d6) Acid damage.

traits.name: Transparent
traits.text: Even when the cube is in plain sight, a creature must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom (Perception skill) check to notice the cube if the creature hasn't witnessed the cube move or otherwise act.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.text: Melee Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. 12 (3d6 + 2) Acid damage.

actions.name: Engulf
actions.text: The cube moves up to its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attack. The cube can move through the spaces of Large or smaller creatures if it has room inside itself to contain them (see the Ooze Cube [Area of Effect] trait). dex save DC 12, each creature whose space the cube enters for the first time during this move. On a failed save, 10 (3d6) Acid damage, and the target is engulfed. An engulfed target is suffocating, can't cast spells with a Verbal component, has the Restrained condition, and takes 10 (3d6) Acid damage at the start of each of the cube's turns. When the cube moves, the engulfed target moves with it. An engulfed target can try to escape by taking an action to make a DC 12 Strength (Athletics skill) check. On a successful check, the target escapes and enters the nearest unoccupied space. On a successful save, Half damage, and the target moves to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the cube. If there is no unoccupied space, the target fails the save instead.

traits.name: Stench
traits.text: con save DC 10, any creature that starts its turn in a 5-foot Emanation [Area of Effect] originating from the ghast. On a failed save, The target has the Poisoned condition until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, The target is immune to this ghast's Stench for 24 hours.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. 7 (1d8 + 3) Piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) Necrotic damage.

actions.text: Melee Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. 10 (2d6 + 3) Slashing damage. If the target is a non-Undead creature, it is subjected to the following effect. con save DC 10. On a failed save, The target has the Paralyzed condition until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Stench
traits.text: con save DC 13, any creature that starts its turn in a 5-foot Emanation [Area of Effect] originating from the ghast. name: Ghost
immunity: necrotic, poison, charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Ethereal Sight
traits.text: The ghost can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.text: The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The ghost makes two Withering Touch attacks.

actions.name: Withering Touch
actions.text: Melee Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. 19 (3d10 + 3) Necrotic damage.

actions.name: Horrific Visage
actions.text: wis save DC 13, each creature in a 60-foot Cone [Area of Effect] that can see the ghost and isn't an Undead. On a failed save, 10 (2d6 + 3) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the start of the ghost's next turn. On a successful save, The target is immune to this ghost's Horrific Visage for 24 hours.

actions.name: Possession (Recharge)
actions.text:
cha save DC 13, one Humanoid the ghost can see within 5 feet. On a failed save, The target is possessed by the ghost; the ghost disappears, and the target has the Incapacitated condition and loses control of its body. The ghost now controls the body, but the target retains awareness. The ghost can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that specifically target Undead. The ghost's game statistics are the same, except it uses the possessed target's Speed, as well as the target's Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution modifiers.
The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 Hit Points or the ghost leaves as a Bonus Action. When the possession ends, the ghost appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target, and the target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours. On a successful save, The target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.text:
The ghost casts the Etherealness spell, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability. The ghost is visible on the Material Plane while on the Border Ethereal and vice versa, but it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.
At will: Etherealness

actions.text: The toad swallows a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. While swallowed, the target isn't Grappled but has the Blinded and Restrained conditions, and it has Cover against attacks and other effects outside the toad. In addition, the target takes 10 (3d6) Acid damage at the end of each of the toad's turns. The toad can have only one target swallowed at a time, and it can't use Bite while it has a swallowed target. If the toad dies, a swallowed creature is no longer Restrained and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting with the Prone condition.

actions.name: Poisonous Spittle
actions.text: con save DC 16, one creature the naga can see within 60 feet. On a failed save, 31 (7d8) Poison damage, and the target has the Blinded condition until the start of the naga's next turn. On a successful save, Half damage only.

traits.name: Blight Seeds
traits.text: When it finishes a Long Rest, the blight expels 1d6 seeds into unoccupied spaces on the ground within 30 feet of itself. After 24 hours, the seeds become creatures under the blight's control. Roll 1d8 for each seed to determine the creature it becomes: on 1-4, Twig Blight; on 5-6, Needle Blight; on 7-8, Vine Blight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The blight makes two attacks, using Slam or Thorn Volley in any combination. It also uses Life-Draining Root.

actions.name: Slam
actions.text: Melee Attack +12 to hit, reach 10 ft. 25 (4d8 + 7) Bludgeoning damage.

actions.text: con save DC 20, one Huge or smaller creature the blight can see within 30 feet. On a failed save, 14 (2d6 + 7) Necrotic damage, and the target has the Grappled condition (escape DC 17) from one of six roots. Until the grapple ends, the target has the Restrained condition and takes 14 (4d6) Necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. The target's Hit Points maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and the blight regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

actions.name: Luring Song
actions.text: The harpy sings a magical melody, which lasts until the harpy's Concentration ends on it. wis save DC 11, each Humanoid and Giant in a 300-foot Emanation [Area of Effect] originating from the harpy when the song starts. On a failed save, The target has the Charmed condition until the song ends and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns. While Charmed, the target has the Incapacitated condition and ignores the Luring Song of other harpies. If the target is more than 5 feet from the harpy, the target moves on its turn toward the harpy by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet of the harpy. It doesn't avoid Opportunity Attack; however, before moving into damaging terrain (such as lava or a pit) and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the harpy, the target repeats the save. On a successful save, The target is immune to this harpy's Luring Song for 24 hours.

traits.name: Undead Restoration
traits.text: If the revenant dies, it revives 24 hours later unless Dispel Evil and Good is cast on its remains. If it revives, it animates another Gargantuan object or structure elsewhere on the same plane of existence; it now looks different but uses the same stat block and returns with all its Hit Points.

actions.text: Melee or Ranged Attack +9 to hit (with Advantage if the target is inside the revenant's space), reach 10 ft. or range 30/90 ft. 27 (5d8 + 5) Bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Invitation
actions.text:
cha save DC 17, each creature in a 60-foot Cone [Area of Effect]. On a failed save, The target is teleported inside the revenant's space and swallowed. A swallowed creature has Cover against attacks and other effects outside the revenant.
While the revenant has Hit Points, a swallowed creature can leave the revenant's space only by using magic that enables planar travel, such as the Plane Shift spell.

The wound closes after 1 minute, after a spell restores Hit Points to the target, or after the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to stanch the wound, doing so by succeeding on a DC 17 Wisdom (Medicine skill) check.

traits.text: The hydra has five heads. Whenever the hydra takes 25 damage or more on a single turn, one of its heads dies. The hydra dies if all its heads are dead. At the end of each of its turns when it has at least one living head, the hydra grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken Fire damage since its last turn. The hydra regains 20 Hit Points when it grows new heads.

traits.name: Reactive Heads
traits.text: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra Reaction that can be used only for Opportunity Attack.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The hydra makes as many Bite attacks as it has heads.

The spear magically returns to the devil's hand immediately after a ranged attack.

actions.text: The imp shape-shifts to resemble a rat (Speed 20 ft.), a raven (20 ft., Fly 60 ft.), or a spider (20 ft., Climb 20 ft.), or it returns to its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form, except for its Speed. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

actions.name: Spellcasting

actions.text: Melee Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. 15 (3d6 + 5) Psychic damage, and the target is cursed for 24 hours or until the incubus dies. Until the curse ends, the target gains no benefit from finishing Short Rests.

actions.text:
The incubus casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):
At will: Disguise Self, Etherealness
1/day: Dream, Hypnotic Pattern

bonus_actions.text: wis save DC 15, one creature the incubus can see within 60 feet. On a failed save, If the target has 20 Hit Points or fewer, it has the Unconscious condition for 1 hour, until it takes damage, or until a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to wake it. Otherwise, the target takes 18 (4d8) Psychic damage.

name: Intellect Devourer
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak; telepathy 60 ft.

traits.name: Detect Intelligence
traits.text: The intellect devourer magically senses the location of any creature within 300 feet of itself that has an Intelligence score of 3 or higher, regardless of interposing barriers.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The intellect devourer makes one Claw attack and uses Devour Intellect.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. 7 (2d4 + 2) Slashing damage.

actions.name: Devour Intellect
actions.text: int save DC 12, one creature the intellect devourer can see within 5 feet. On a failed save, 11 (2d10) Psychic damage, and the target has the Stunned condition until the end of the intellect devourer's next turn.

actions.name: Steal Body
actions.text:
int save DC 12, one Small or Medium creature within 5 feet that has the Incapacitated condition, is a Humanoid or Beast, and has 10 Hit Points or fewer. On a failed save, The intellect devourer possesses the target, consumes its brain, and teleports inside its skull. While there, the intellect devourer has Cover against attacks and other effects originating outside its host. The intellect devourer retains its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; its understanding of Deep Speech; its telepathy; and its Detect Intelligence trait. It otherwise adopts the target's game statistics. It knows everything the target knew, including spells and languages.
If the host body dies, the intellect devourer must leave it. The intellect devourer is also forced out if the target regains its devoured brain by means of a Wish spell. By spending 5 feet of its movement, the intellect devourer can voluntarily leave the body, teleporting to the nearest unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. The body then dies unless its brain is restored before the end of the intellect devourer's next turn.

name: Kraken
immunity: cold, lightning, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, restrained
languages: understands Abyssal, Celestial, Infernal, and Primordial but can't speak; telepathy 120 ft.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The kraken can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day, or 5/Day in Lair)
traits.text: If the kraken fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The kraken deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The kraken makes two Tentacle attacks and uses Fling, Lightning Strike, or Swallow.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.text: Melee Attack +17 to hit, reach 30 ft. 24 (4d6 + 10) Bludgeoning damage. The target has the Grappled condition (escape DC 20) from one of ten tentacles, and it has the Restrained condition until the grapple ends.

actions.name: Fling
actions.text: The kraken throws a Large or smaller creature Grappled by it to a space it can see within 60 feet of itself that isn't in the air. dex save DC 25, the creature thrown and each creature in the destination space. On a failed save, 18 (4d8) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the Prone condition. On a successful save, Half damage only.

actions.name: Lightning Strike
actions.text: dex save DC 23, one creature the kraken can see within 120 feet. On a failed save, 33 (6d10) Lightning damage. On a successful save, Half damage.

actions.name: Swallow
actions.text:
dex save DC 25, one creature Grappled by the kraken (it can have up to four creatures swallowed at a time). On a failed save, 23 (3d8 + 10) Piercing damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is swallowed and no longer Grappled. A swallowed creature has the Restrained condition, has Cover against attacks and other effects outside the kraken, and takes 24 (7d6) Acid damage at the start of each of its turns.
If the kraken takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the kraken must succeed on a DC 25 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which falls in a space within 10 feet of the kraken with the Prone condition. If the kraken dies, any swallowed creature no longer has the Restrained condition and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting Prone.

legendary_actions.name: Legendary Actions
legendary_actions.text:
Legendary Action Uses: 3 (4 in Lair). Immediately after another creature's turn, The Kraken can expend a use to take one of the following actions. The creature regains all expended uses at the start of each of its turns.

Storm Bolt. The kraken uses Lightning Strike.

Toxic Ink. con save DC 23, each creature in a 15-foot Emanation [Area of Effect] originating from the kraken while it is underwater. On a failed save, The target has the Blinded and Poisoned conditions until the end of the kraken's next turn. The kraken then moves up to its Speed. On a success or failure, The kraken can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

On a failed save, The target has the Restrained condition until the net is destroyed (AC 10; HP 5; Immunity to Bludgeoning, Poison, and Psychic damage). A creature can take an action to make a DC 10 Strength (Athletics skill) check to free itself or another creature in a net within 5 feet, destroying the net on a success.

On a failed save, The attack's weapon sticks to the kuo-toa's shield. If the target doesn't let go of the weapon, the target has the Grappled condition while the weapon is stuck (escape DC 11). While stuck, the weapon can't be used. The target can take an action to make a DC 11 Strength (Athletics skill) check, freeing the weapon on a success.

actions.name: Rotting Fist

A creature dies and turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points by this attack.

actions.name: Dreadful Glare
actions.text: wis save DC 11, one creature the mummy can see within 60 feet. On a failed save, The target has the Frightened condition until the end of the mummy's next turn. On a successful save, The target is immune to this mummy's Dreadful Glare for 24 hours.

traits.name: Undead Restoration
traits.text: If destroyed, the mummy gains a new body in 24 hours if its heart is intact, reviving with all its Hit Points. The new body appears in an unoccupied space within the mummy's lair. The heart is a Tiny object that has AC 17, HP 10, and Immunity to all damage except Fire.

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.name: Rotting Fist
actions.text: Melee Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. 15 (2d10 + 4) Bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it is cursed. A creature dies and turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points by this attack.

actions.name: Channel Negative Energy
actions.text: Ranged Attack +9 to hit, range 60 ft. 25 (6d6 + 4) Necrotic damage.

At will: Dispel Magic, Thaumaturgy
1/day: Animate Dead, Harm, Insect Plague (level 7 version)

reactions.text: Trigger: The mummy is hit by an attack roll. Response: The mummy adds 2 to its AC against the attack, possibly causing the attack to miss, and the mummy teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Each creature of its choice that it can see within 5 feet of its destination space has the Blinded condition until the end of the mummy's next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Legendary Actions
legendary_actions.text:
Legendary Action Uses: 3 (4 in Lair). Immediately after another creature's turn, The Mummy Lord can expend a use to take one of the following actions. The creature regains all expended uses at the start of each of its turns.

Glare. The mummy uses Dreadful Glare. The mummy can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Necrotic Strike. The mummy makes one Rotting Fist or Channel Negative Energy attack.

The bag has AC 15, HP 20, and Resistance to all damage. The bag turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points. If the bag is destroyed, any souls the bag is holding are released. The hag can create a new bag after 7 days.

While on the Ethereal Plane, the hag casts Dream, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting. Only the hag can serve as the spell's messenger, and the target must be a creature the hag can see on the Material Plane. The spell fails and is wasted if the target is under the effect of the Protection from Evil and Good spell or within a Magic Circle spell. If the target takes damage from the Dream spell, the target's Hit Points maximum decreases by an amount equal to that damage. If the spell kills the target, its soul is trapped in the hag's soul bag, and the target can't be raised from the dead until its soul is released.
